snippet: South Korea's arms procurement agency said on Monday that Indonesia had agreed to pay 20 percent of the development costs of a mid-level fighter jet programme that some analysts said could cost up to $8 billion (5.01 billion pounds)....

headline.print_headline: Indonesia to Co-Develop $8 Billion South Korea Fighter Jet Project
headline.main: Indonesia to Co-Develop $8 Billion South Korea Fighter Jet Project

lead_paragraph: South Korea's arms procurement agency said on Monday that Indonesia had agreed to pay 20 percent of the development costs of a mid-level fighter jet programme that some analysts said could cost up to $8 billion (5.01 billion pounds).
